public_port.title: Public facing port for TCP/UDP (may be mapped on shared LB reverse proxy)

fqdn_prefix.description:
skip 4 to preserve the numbering. 4 was path_prefix but was removed since we dont need it after removed http
FQDN prefix to append to base FQDN in FindCloudlet response. May be empty.

end_port.description: A non-zero end port indicates a port range from internal port to end port, inclusive.

nginx.title: use nginx proxy for this port if you really need a transparent proxy (udp only)

distributed_match_engineAppPort.description: AppPort describes an L4 or L7 public access port/path mapping. This is used to track external to internal mappings for access via a shared load balancer or reverse proxy.
distributed_match_engineAppPort.title: Application Port

distributed_match_engineLProto.description:
LProto indicates which protocol to use for accessing an application on a particular port. This is required by Kubernetes for port mapping.

 - L_PROTO_UNKNOWN: Unknown protocol
 - L_PROTO_TCP: TCP (L4) protocol
 - L_PROTO_UDP: UDP (L4) protocol

altitude.title:
On android only lat and long are guaranteed to be supplied
altitude in meters

course.title: course (IOS) / bearing (Android) (degrees east relative to true north)

distributed_match_engineTimestamp.title:
This is a simple Timestamp message type
grpc-gateway converts google.protobuf.Timestamp into an RFC3339-type string
which is a waste of a conversion, so we define our own

edgeprotoAccessType.title:
- ACCESS_TYPE_DEFAULT_FOR_DEPLOYMENT: Default load balancer or direct based on deployment
 - ACCESS_TYPE_DIRECT: Direct access with no load balancer
 - ACCESS_TYPE_LOAD_BALANCER: Access via a load balancer

annotations.title: Annotations are extra information about the alert

notify_id.title: Id of client assigned by server (internal use only)

fields.title: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

access_ports.title:
Comma separated list of protocol:port pairs that the App listens on.
Numerical values must be decimal format.
i.e. tcp:80,udp:10002,http:443

default_flavor.title: Default flavor for the App, which may be overridden by the AppInst

command.title: Command that the container runs to start service

annotations.title:
Annotations is a comma separated map of arbitrary key value pairs,
for example: key1=val1,key2=val2,key3="val 3"

deployment_manifest.title:
Deployment manifest is the deployment specific manifest file/config
For docker deployment, this can be a docker-compose or docker run file
For kubernetes deployment, this can be a kubernetes yaml or helm chart file

deployment_generator.title: Deployment generator target to generate a basic deployment manifest

android_package_name.title: Android package name used to match the App name from the Android package

configs.title: Customization files passed through to implementing services

scale_with_cluster.title: Option to run App on all nodes of the cluster

internal_ports.title: Should this app have access to outside world?

revision.title: Revision can be specified or defaults to current timestamp when app is updated

official_fqdn.title: Official FQDN is the FQDN that the app uses to connect by default

md5sum.title: MD5Sum of the VM-based app image

default_shared_volume_size.title: shared volume size when creating auto cluster

default_privacy_policy.title: Privacy policy when creating auto cluster

template_delimiter.title: Delimiter to be used for template parsing, defaults to "[[ ]]"

skip_hc_ports.title:
Comma separated list of protocol:port pairs that we should not run health check on
Should be configured in case app does not always listen on these ports
"all" can be specified if no health check to be run for this app
Numerical values must be decimal format.
i.e. tcp:80,udp:10002,http:443

edgeprotoApp.description: App belongs to developer organizations and is used to provide information about their application.
edgeprotoApp.title: Application

fields.title: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

uri.description: Base FQDN (not really URI) for the App. See Service FQDN for endpoint access.

mapped_ports.description:
For instances accessible via a shared load balancer, defines the external
ports on the shared load balancer that map to the internal ports
External ports should be appended to the Uri for L4 access.

state.title: Current state of the AppInst on the Cloudlet

errors.title: Any errors trying to create, update, or delete the AppInst on the Cloudlet

status.title: status is used to reflect progress of creation or other events

revision.title: Revision changes each time the App is updated.  Refreshing the App Instance will sync the revision with that of the App

force_update.description: Force Appinst refresh even if revision number matches App revision number.

update_multiple.title: Allow multiple instances to be updated at once

configs.title: Customization files passed through to implementing services

shared_volume_size.title: shared volume size when creating auto cluster

external_volume_size.title: Size of external volume to be attached to nodes.  This is for the root partition

opt_res.title: Optional Resources required by OS flavor if any

AppInst is an instance of an App on a Cloudlet where it is defined by an App plus a ClusterInst key. 
Many of the fields here are inherited from the App definition.

Whereas the AppInst defines the intent of instantiating an App on a Cloudlet, the AppInstInfo defines the current state of trying to apply that intent on the physical resources of the Cloudlet.

something.description:
what goes here?
Note that metrics for grpc calls can be done by a prometheus
interceptor in grpc, so adding call metrics here may be
redundant unless they're needed for billing.

They are not stored in the persistent distributed database, but are stored as a time series in some other database or files.

insts.title: AppInsts for App (key is JSON of AppInst Key)

edgeprotoAutoProvCloudlet.title: AutoProvCloudlet stores the potential cloudlet and location for DME lookup

fields.title: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

deploy_client_count.title: Minimum number of clients within the auto deploy interval to trigger deployment

deploy_interval_count.title: Number of intervals to check before triggering deployment

min_active_instances.title: Minimum number of active instances for High-Availability

max_instances.title: Maximum number of instances (active or not)

undeploy_client_count.title: Number of active clients for the undeploy interval below which trigers undeployment, 0 (default) disables auto undeploy

undeploy_interval_count.title: Number of intervals to check before triggering undeployment

edgeprotoAutoProvPolicy.title: AutoProvPolicy defines the automated provisioning policy

edgeprotoAutoProvPolicyCloudlet.title: AutoProvPolicyCloudlet is used to add and remove Cloudlets from the Auto Provisioning Policy

fields.title: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

trigger_time_sec.description: Trigger time defines how long trigger threshold must be satified in seconds before acting upon it.

edgeprotoAutoScalePolicy.description:
AutoScalePolicy defines when and how ClusterInsts will have their
nodes scaled up or down.

edgeprotoCRMOverride.description:
CRMOverride can be applied to commands that issue requests to the CRM.
It should only be used by administrators when bugs have caused the
Controller and CRM to get out of sync. It allows commands from the
Controller to ignore errors from the CRM, or ignore the CRM completely
(messages will not be sent to CRM).

 - NO_OVERRIDE: No override
 - IGNORE_CRM_ERRORS: Ignore errors from CRM
 - IGNORE_CRM: Ignore CRM completely (does not inform CRM of operation)
 - IGNORE_TRANSIENT_STATE: Ignore Transient State (only admin should use if CRM crashed)
 - IGNORE_CRM_AND_TRANSIENT_STATE: Ignore CRM and Transient State
edgeprotoCRMOverride.title: Overrides default CRM behaviour

fields.title: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

static_ips.title: List of static IPs for static IP support

num_dynamic_ips.title: Number of dynamic IPs available for dynamic IP support

time_limits.title: time limits which override global settings if non-zero

flavor.title: Min system resource requirements for platform

res_tag_map.title: Optional resource to restagtbl key map key values = [gpu, nas, nic]

vm_image_version.title: MobiledgeX baseimage version where CRM services reside

deployment.title: Deployment type to bring up CRM services (docker, kubernetes)

infra_api_access.title: Infra Access Type is the type of access available to Infra API Endpoint

override_policy_container_version.title: Override container version from policy file

os_max_vol_gb.title: Maximum amount of disk in GB on the Cloudlet

controller_cache_received.title: Indicates all controller data has been sent to CRM

manifest.description: Manifest to bringup cloudlet VM and services.

edgeprotoCloudletPool.description: CloudletPool defines a pool of Cloudlets that have restricted access.

organization.title: Name of the organization this pool belongs to

edgeprotoCloudletPoolMember.title: CloudletPoolMember is used to add and remove a Cloudlet from a CloudletPool

properties.title: Single Key-Value pair of env var to be passed to CRM

root_lb_ports.title:
Used ports on root load balancer. Map key is public port, value is a bitmap for the protocol
bitmap: bit 0: tcp, bit 1: udp

edgeprotoCloudletRefs.description: CloudletRefs track used resources and Clusters instantiated on a Cloudlet. Used resources are compared against max resources for a Cloudlet to determine if resources are available for a new Cluster to be instantiated on the Cloudlet.

edgeprotoCloudletResMap.title: optional resource input consists of a resource specifier and clouldkey name

edgeprotoCloudletState.description:
CloudletState is the state of the Cloudlet.

 - CLOUDLET_STATE_UNKNOWN: Unknown
 - CLOUDLET_STATE_ERRORS: Create/Delete/Update encountered errors (see Errors field of CloudletInfo)
 - CLOUDLET_STATE_READY: Cloudlet is created and ready
 - CLOUDLET_STATE_OFFLINE: Cloudlet is offline (unreachable)
 - CLOUDLET_STATE_NOT_PRESENT: Cloudlet is not present
 - CLOUDLET_STATE_INIT: Cloudlet is initializing
 - CLOUDLET_STATE_UPGRADE: Cloudlet is upgrading
 - CLOUDLET_STATE_NEED_SYNC: Cloudlet needs data to synchronize

num_nodes.title: Number of k8s nodes (In case of docker deployment, this field is not required)

ClusterInst is an instance of a Cluster on a Cloudlet. 
It is defined by a Cluster, Cloudlet, and Developer key.

Each AppInst specifies a set of required resources (Flavor), so tracking resources used by Apps within a Cluster is necessary to determine if enough resources are available for another AppInst to be instantiated on a ClusterInst.

DeleteType specifies if AppInst can be auto deleted or not

 - NO_AUTO_DELETE: No autodelete
 - AUTO_DELETE: Autodelete
edgeprotoDeleteType.title: DeleteType

first_seen.title: Timestamp when the device was registered

last_seen.title: Timestamp when the device was last seen(Future use)

Device represents a device on the MobiledgeX platform
We record when this device first showed up on our platform

unique_id_type.title: Type of unique ID provided by the client

DeviceKey is an identifier for a given device on the MobiledgeX platform
It is defined by a unique id and unique id type
And example of such a device is a MEL device that hosts several applications

begin.title: Timestamp of the beginning of the report

end.title: Timestamp of the beginning of the report

DeviceReport is a reporting message. It takes a begining and end time
for the report

container_id.title: ContainerId is the name or ID of the target container, if applicable

Optional Resources request, key = [gpu, nas, nic] gpu kinds: [gpu, vgpu, pci]
form: $resource=$kind:[$alias]$count ex: optresmap=gpu=vgpus:nvidia-63:1

edgeprotoFlavor.description:
Flavors define the compute, memory, and storage capacity of computing instances. 
To put it simply, a flavor is an available hardware configuration for a server. 
It defines the size of a virtual server that can be launched.

name.title: Name of the flavor on the Cloudlet

vcpus.title: Number of VCPU cores on the Cloudlet

ram.title: Ram in MB on the Cloudlet

disk.title: Amount of disk in GB on the Cloudlet

edgeprotoHealthCheck.description:
Health check status gets set by external, or rootLB health check

 - HEALTH_CHECK_UNKNOWN: Health Check is unknown
 - HEALTH_CHECK_FAIL_ROOTLB_OFFLINE: Health Check failure due to RootLB being offline
 - HEALTH_CHECK_FAIL_SERVER_FAIL: Health Check failure due to Backend server being unavailable
 - HEALTH_CHECK_OK: Health Check is ok
edgeprotoHealthCheck.title: Health check status

edgeprotoImageType.description:
ImageType specifies image type of an App

 - IMAGE_TYPE_UNKNOWN: Unknown image type
 - IMAGE_TYPE_DOCKER: Docker container image type compatible either with Docker or Kubernetes
 - IMAGE_TYPE_QCOW: QCOW2 virtual machine image type
 - IMAGE_TYPE_HELM: Helm chart is a separate image type
edgeprotoImageType.title: ImageType

edgeprotoInfraApiAccess.description:
InfraApiAccess is the type of access available to Infra API endpoint

 - DIRECT_ACCESS: Infra API endpoint is accessible from public network
 - RESTRICTED_ACCESS: Infra API endpoint is not accessible from public network
edgeprotoInfraApiAccess.title: Infra API Access

edgeprotoInfraConfig.title: Infra specific configuration used for Cloudlet deployments

edgeprotoIpAccess.description:
IpAccess indicates the type of RootLB that Developer requires for their App

 - IP_ACCESS_UNKNOWN: Unknown IP access
 - IP_ACCESS_DEDICATED: Dedicated RootLB
 - IP_ACCESS_SHARED: Shared RootLB
edgeprotoIpAccess.title: IpAccess Options

edgeprotoIpSupport.description:
Static IP support indicates a set of static public IPs are available for use, and managed by the Controller. Dynamic indicates the Cloudlet uses a DHCP server to provide public IP addresses, and the controller has no control over which IPs are assigned.

 - IP_SUPPORT_UNKNOWN: Unknown IP support
 - IP_SUPPORT_STATIC: Static IP addresses are provided to and managed by Controller
 - IP_SUPPORT_DYNAMIC: IP addresses are dynamically provided by an Operator's DHCP server
edgeprotoIpSupport.title: Type of public IP support

edgeprotoLiveness.description:
Liveness indicates if an object was created statically via an external API call, or dynamically via an internal algorithm.

 - LIVENESS_UNKNOWN: Unknown liveness
 - LIVENESS_STATIC: Object managed by external entity
 - LIVENESS_DYNAMIC: Object managed internally
 - LIVENESS_AUTOPROV: Object created by Auto Provisioning, treated like Static except when deleting App
edgeprotoLiveness.title: Liveness Options

edgeprotoMaintenanceState.description:
Maintenance allows for planned downtimes of Cloudlets.
These states involve message exchanges between the Controller,
the AutoProv service, and the CRM. Certain states are only set
by certain actors.

 - NORMAL_OPERATION: Normal operational state
 - MAINTENANCE_START: Request start of maintenance
 - FAILOVER_REQUESTED: Trigger failover for any HA AppInsts
 - FAILOVER_DONE: Failover done
 - FAILOVER_ERROR: Some errors encountered during maintenance failover
 - MAINTENANCE_START_NO_FAILOVER: Request start of maintenance without AutoProv failover
 - CRM_REQUESTED: Request CRM to transition to maintenance
 - CRM_UNDER_MAINTENANCE: CRM request done and under maintenance
 - CRM_ERROR: CRM failed to go into maintenance
 - UNDER_MAINTENANCE: Under maintenance
edgeprotoMaintenanceState.title: Cloudlet Maintenance States

NoticeAction denotes what kind of action this notification is for.

 - UPDATE: Update the object
 - DELETE: Delete the object
 - VERSION: Version exchange negotitation message
 - SENDALL_END: Initial send all finished message

edgeprotoOperationTimeLimits.description: Time limits for cloudlet create, update and delete operations
edgeprotoOperationTimeLimits.title: Operation time limits

code.description: MCC plus MNC code, or custom carrier code designation.

port_range_min.title: TCP or UDP port range start

container_registry_path.title: Path to Docker registry holding edge-cloud image

notify_ctrl_addrs.title: Address of controller notify port (can be multiple of these)

commercial_certs.title: Get certs from vault or generate your own for the root load balancer

use_vault_certs.title: Use Vault certs for internal TLS communication

use_vault_cas.title: Use Vault CAs to authenticate TLS communication

edgeprotoPlatformConfig.title: Platform specific configuration required for Cloudlet management

edgeprotoPlatformType.description:
PlatformType is the supported list of cloudlet types

 - PLATFORM_TYPE_FAKE: Fake Cloudlet
 - PLATFORM_TYPE_DIND: DIND Cloudlet
 - PLATFORM_TYPE_OPENSTACK: Openstack Cloudlet
 - PLATFORM_TYPE_AZURE: Azure Cloudlet
 - PLATFORM_TYPE_GCP: GCP Cloudlet
 - PLATFORM_TYPE_EDGEBOX: Edgebox Cloudlet
 - PLATFORM_TYPE_FAKEINFRA: Fake Infra Cloudlet
 - PLATFORM_TYPE_VSPHERE: VMWare VSphere (ESXi)
 - PLATFORM_TYPE_AWS: AWS Cloudlet
 - PLATFORM_TYPE_VM_POOL: VM Pool Cloudlet
edgeprotoPlatformType.title: Platform Type

organization.title: Name of the organization for the cluster that this policy will apply to

edgeprotoPowerState.description:
Power State of the AppInst

 - POWER_STATE_UNKNOWN: Unknown
 - POWER_ON_REQUESTED: Power On Requested
 - POWERING_ON: Powering On
 - POWER_ON: Power On
 - POWER_OFF_REQUESTED: Power Off Requested
 - POWERING_OFF: Powering Off
 - POWER_OFF: Power Off
 - REBOOT_REQUESTED: Reboot Requested
 - REBOOTING: Rebooting
 - REBOOT: Reboot
 - POWER_STATE_ERROR: Error
edgeprotoPowerState.title: Power State

outbound_security_rules.title: list of outbound security rules for whitelisting traffic

PrivacyPolicy defines security restrictions for cluster instances
nodes scaled up or down.

internal.title: Is the property internal, not to be set by Operator

azone.title: availability zone(s) of resource if required

message.title: Message, may be success or failure message

code.title: Error code, 0 indicates success, non-zero indicates failure (not implemented)

shepherd_metrics_collection_interval.title: Shepherd metrics collection interval for k8s and docker appInstances (duration)

shepherd_alert_evaluation_interval.title: Shepherd alert evaluation interval for k8s and docker appInstances (duration)

shepherd_health_check_retries.title: Number of times Shepherd Health Check fails before we mark appInst down

auto_deploy_offset_sec.title: Auto Provisioning analysis offset from interval (seconds)

auto_deploy_max_intervals.title: Auto Provisioning Policy max allowed intervals

master_node_flavor.title: Default flavor for k8s master VM and > 0  workers

load_balancer_max_port_range.title: Max IP Port range when using a load balancer

max_tracked_dme_clients.description: Max DME clients to be tracked at the same time.

cloudlet_maintenance_timeout.title: Default Cloudlet Maintenance timeout (used twice for AutoProv and Cloudlet)

since.title: Show logs since either a duration ago (5s, 2m, 3h) or a timestamp (RFC3339)

tail.title: Show only a recent number of lines

edgeprotoStatusInfo.description:
Used to track status of create/delete/update for resources that are being modified 
by the controller via the CRM.  Tasks are the high level jobs that are to be completed.
Steps are work items within a task. Within the clusterinst and appinst objects this
is converted to a string
edgeprotoStatusInfo.title: Status Information

edgeprotoTrackedState.description:
TrackedState is used to track the state of an object on a remote node,
i.e. track the state of a ClusterInst object on the CRM (Cloudlet).

 - TRACKED_STATE_UNKNOWN: Unknown state
 - NOT_PRESENT: Not present (does not exist)
 - CREATE_REQUESTED: Create requested
 - CREATING: Creating
 - CREATE_ERROR: Create error
 - READY: Ready
 - UPDATE_REQUESTED: Update requested
 - UPDATING: Updating
 - UPDATE_ERROR: Update error
 - DELETE_REQUESTED: Delete requested
 - DELETING: Deleting
 - DELETE_ERROR: Delete error
 - DELETE_PREPARE: Delete prepare (extra state used by controller to block other changes)
 - CRM_INITOK: CRM INIT OK
 - CREATING_DEPENDENCIES: Creating dependencies (state used to tracked dependent object change progress)
edgeprotoTrackedState.title: Tracked States

fields.title: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

vms.title: list of VMs to be part of VM pool

state.title: Current state of the VM pool

errors.title: Any errors trying to add/remove VM to/from VM Pool

status.title: status is used to reflect progress of creation or other events

edgeprotoVMPool.title: VMPool defines a pool of VMs to be part of a Cloudlet

edgeprotoVMPoolMember.title: VMPoolMember is used to add and remove VM from VM Pool

edgeprotoVMState.description:
VMState is the state of the VM

 - VM_FREE: VM is free to use
 - VM_IN_PROGRESS: VM is in progress
 - VM_IN_USE: VM is in use
 - VM_ADD: Add VM
 - VM_REMOVE: Remove VM
 - VM_UPDATE: Update VM
 - VM_FORCE_FREE: Forcefully free a VM, to be used at user's discretion
edgeprotoVMState.title: VM State

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.
